alert.note: Alert for Lancaster; Saunders; Seward (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 2:38PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lancaster, east central Seward and southwestern Saunders Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 237 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Emerald, or 7 miles west of Lincoln, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Raymond around 250 PM CDT. Davey around 255 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ceresco, Valparaiso, Wahoo, Weston and Malmo. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 388 and 405. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
